FuncDef:
The fr lmi n392dce command configures an error threshold (N392) used for LMI negotiation on a DCE.
The undo fr lmi n392dce command restores the default configuration.
By default, the N392 value is 3 on a DCE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an error threshold used for LMI negotiation on a DCE.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Local Management Interface (LMI) is a protocol that uses status enquiry messages and state messages to maintain link and PVC status, and its working process is as follows:
A DCE requests a status enquiry message from a DTE at an interval specified by T392. If the DCE does not receive a status enquiry message during this interval, the DCE records the error and increases the number of error events by 1. If the number of error events is greater than the error threshold, the DCE considers the physical link and all VCs unavailable.
To configure an error threshold, run the fr lmi n392dce command.
Prerequisites
The FR interface type has been set to DCE using the fr interface-type command.
Configuration Impact
Running the fr lmi n392dce command changes the error threshold, which affects the LMI negotiation rate.
If the fr lmi n392dce command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
N393 indicates the total number of monitored events. N392 indicates the threshold of error events in the monitored events. N392 and N393 work together to determine the error threshold.
The value of N392 must be smaller than that of N393 on a DCE.
